INDONESIAN STREET.
INDONESIAN FUSION.

The Mission

We’re here to launch the next Asian food craze in the United States. Tempe, Rendang, Bubur, Soto, Sambal, Martabak: These should be as well known as Chicken Tikka Masala, Pho and Pad Thai.


But Kaki Lima is not just a culinary enterprise. It’s diplomacy. Most Americans know little about Indonesia. Kaki Lima seeks to change that. We want to promote the best of Indonesia at every turn, from its food to its innovative music, art, design and activism. Kaki Lima looks forward, not back. We are a part of Indonesia’s bright future, in our little corner of the United States.

The People

The Chef

Retno Pratiwi

My East Javanese grandmother would start cooking just before sunrise. I'd wake up to the sounds of the kitchen, and the knock-out aromas of terasi, chili, toasted coriander and kaffir lime. When I was young, she carried me around in a sling as she cooked. As I grew older, I asked her to teach me everything she knew. She did.


I later got my culinary degree at the Cambridge School for Culinary Arts. I've worked in various kitchens in the Boston area since, but am now solely focused on the Indonesian cuisine that I know and love.

The Boss

Peter Gelling

I spent six years as a journalist writing for the New York Times, International Herald Tribune and GlobalPost in Indonesia, where as a reporting team Retno and I traveled the country, eating and writing all the way. It didn’t take long to fall in love with both Retno and Indonesia.


I am now committed to introducing the beautiful country and its cuisine to an American audience. I run the communications and business side of things at Kaki Lima. And I know who the real boss is.

The Food

Kaki Lima is a celebration of Indonesia’s cuisine first and foremost. Our menus are authentic. They are built around the freshest available ingredients used in Indonesian cooking — coconut, pandan, banana leaf, kaffir lime, coriander, chili, shallots, lemongrass, galangal, turmeric leaf, terasi and kecap manis, to name just a few. Expect the classics, and also some experimental fusion that remains reverent to Indonesia’s taste and cooking methods, while highlighting its spirit of innovation. This food is made with love.

The Services

Catering

We will come to you. We can cook in your home or deliver a fully catered meal, for 2 people or 200 people. Find us on kitchensurfing.com or email us.

Pop-ups

We regularly camp out at restaurants around Boston. Follow us on Facebook and Twitter to find out where we will be next.

Restuarant

This is our ultimate goal. Follow us as we perfect menus, seek spaces and investors, and just generally have a good time on our way.
